I prefer these games in the same way I prefer non fiction books. They're playful and fun but have an anchor in reality that I value.
Lets not even talk about the fact I grew up playing the GTA that takes place in NYC and later moved there. Totally new places feel familiar.
I got really into this game called Bridge Simulator and now when I see really crazy bridges I'm like "ohhh, that's how you do that!!"
My addiction to City Simulator means that occasionally I'll see a nice road layout or highway merge in NYC and be like "I'ma use that"
I love games that make me look at the world around me in a different way.
My obsession with click-capitalism games has evolved into an obsession with this app that lets me trade stocks with fake money
